key_insight: GateFusion introduces a Hierarchical Gated Fusion Decoder (HiGat) that enables fine-grained, multi-level audioâ€“visual interaction between strong pretrained unimodal encoders, improving active speaker detection where late fusion fails.
problem_solved: Addresses the failure of late fusion to capture detailed cross-modal correlations, especially under noisy or unconstrained video/audio conditions, by selectively integrating complementary signals across hierarchy levels.
method: Use strong pretrained visual and audio encoders to extract robust unimodal features.
Apply a Hierarchical Gated Fusion Decoder (HiGat) that progressively fuses audio and visual features at multiple levels with learned gates to emphasize informative signals and suppress noise.
Produce frame-wise active-speaker predictions leveraging cross-modal attention and gating for fine-grained temporal and spatial alignment.
impact: Provides a practical, plug-and-play fusion module that boosts ASD accuracy and robustness in real-world videos, enabling practitioners to leverage pretrained encoders while improving cross-modal alignment and interpretability.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram showing pretrained audio & visual encoders feeding into the multi-level HiGat decoder with gating blocks
Flow illustration of a gate: how audio/visual contributions are weighted and combined across hierarchy levels
Before/after performance chart (e.g., precision/recall or mAP) comparing late fusion vs. GateFusion on benchmark datasets
Example frames with audio waveform and per-frame predicted active-speaker overlay to show qualitative improvements
paper_title: GateFusion: Hierarchical Gated Cross-Modal Fusion for Active Speaker Detection
paper_authors: Yu Wang, Juhyung Ha, Frangil M. Ramirez, Yuchen Wang, David J. Crandall
